links.to_node: refuse to take care of the dog unless my sister steps up and takes responsibility.
Your older sister may become upset or angry with you for refusing to help with the dog, leading to potential conflict and tension in the family.
Your mother and younger sister may feel overwhelmed and burdened by the increased responsibility of caring for the untrained dog, potentially leading to strained relationships within the family.
The untrained dog may continue to suffer from neglect and lack of proper care, potentially leading to health and behavioral issues.
Your older sister may feel pressured to either step up and take responsibility for the dog or consider rehoming it, potentially leading to a resolution of the situation.
You may experience emotional distress from witnessing the neglect and mistreatment of the dog, potentially impacting your mental well-being.
The living environment in the small apartment may become increasingly unpleasant due to the dog's untrained behavior, potentially affecting the overall quality of life for everyone in the household.
